headlines.description: Harry Kane was Tottenham Hotspur's hero once again as his header helped the team to a 1-0 win over Wolverhampton Wanderers on Saturday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Kane sets PL record to help Spurs edge Wolves

headlines.description: Two goals from Wilfried Zaha and a late strike by Jean-Philippe Mateta helped Crystal Palace come from behind and defeat Aston Villa 3-1.
headlines.shortLinkText: Zaha bags brace as Palace overcome Villa

headlines.description: Winger Demarai Gray fired home a late equaliser to give Everton a 1-1 draw with Nottingham Forest at Goodison Park on Saturday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Gray rescues Everton draw against Forest

headlines.description: Fulham sealed their first victory of the Premier League campaign by beating Brentford 3-2 on Saturday thanks to a late Aleksandar Mitrovic winner.
headlines.shortLinkText: Mitrovic late winner helps Fulham sink Brentford

headlines.description: Southampton came from behind to beat Leicester City 2-1 in Saturday's Premier League game at the King Power Stadium.
headlines.shortLinkText: Adams inspires Saints comeback at Leicester

headlines.description: Martin Odegaard scored a brace and Gabriel Jesus shone as Arsenal continued their perfect start to the season with a 3-0 win against Bournemouth.
headlines.shortLinkText: Odegaard, Jesus shine in big Arsenal win
